chapter.title: Adding Flavor to Manager with Salt

sect1.title: Introducing Salt
sect1.para: The addition of Salt to &susemgr; 3 fulfils customer demands by providing the latest in configuration management and includes a more consistent systems management framework.
In this chapter you will learn how to set up and configure your VM's created in the previous sections for use with the new Salt framework. In this section of the guide you will:

listitem.para: Configure your &sle; 12 SP1 client as the Salt Minion
Accept the Salt Minion key using the &susemgr; WebUI
Use Salt to manage your client

sect1.title: Salt Minion Setup and Configuration
sect1.para: Once &susemgr; has been installed and setup, by default it is configured as a fully functional Salt Master. In the rest of this chapter &susemgr; will be referred to the Salt Master.
This section covers setup of Salt on the client. Unlike the Salt Master, clients do not have Salt installed by default. Therefore you must install the required packages. In this section you will:

listitem.para: Add the &susemgr; 3 tools repository to the client
Install the required Salt Minion packages

procedure.title: Installing Salt Minion Packages on the Client

step.para: On your client system add the &susemgr; 3 tools repository listed in the beta release notes or directly from the email you received.
Open the YaST Software Management tool. In the search field enter salt and press Enter. Select only the Salt Minion package then click Accept to continue.
Once installation has completed, open a terminal and enter the following commands:

sect1.para: This concludes the Salt Minion configuration section. The next part of this guide will cover acceptance of minions for management via the WebUI.

sect1.title: Accepting Salt Minions for Management
sect1.para: In this section you will accept minions using the &susemgr; WebUI.

step.para: To get started open your browser and point it to your &susemgr; Server address and log in.
Select the Salt tab then Onboarding from the sidebar.
From the All Minions page you see a list of Pending and Rejected minions.
The minion you configured in the previous section should be listed under the Pending column.
To accept the minion for management click the Check button.
Confirm your minion was added by going to the Systems tab. Your new minion is now ready for management by &susemgr; 3.

sect1.para: Congratulations! This concludes setup and configuration of Salt. The next section will introduce using Salt to manage your new minion.
